page.title: 14LOCAL CUSTOMS OF BARSBY
page.content: Many English villages are steeped in loacal history and customs. Barsby is no exception and after interviewing Mrs Yates and Mr Warringtom we were given an insight into the wealth and variety of village customs. A traditional celebration held in the village was the Barsby Feast. It was held on August Bank holiday Monday in Burgins field, burgins was one of the local farmers. All the villagers would share the preperation of the food. On Mayday schoolchildren formed a procession which was led by the may queen. They pareded around the village singing and dancing. As a reward for their songs the villagers gave them money. On Guy Fawkes night school boys travelled around the village with hollowed out turnips with candles in them.
